title: Linux traceroute Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the traceroute command in Linux, learn how to trace the network path to a destination, and troubleshoot network issues using practical examples.

meta.title: Linux traceroute Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the traceroute command in Linux, learn how to trace the network path to a destination, and troubleshoot network issues using practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, traceroute, network, troubleshooting, path tracing, network issues

verify.name: Verify traceroute command installation
verify.hint:
The traceroute command is not installed. Please run the following commands to install it:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y traceroute

steps.title: Tracing the Network Path to a Destination

verify.name: Verify traceroute to www.google.com
verify.hint:
The traceroute to www.google.com was not successful. Please try running the command again:
traceroute www.google.com

verify.name: Verify traceroute to non-existent website
verify.hint: The traceroute to www.non-existent-website.com did not identify any network issues. Please try running the command again and look for any asterisks (*) in the output, which indicate a problem in the network path.
